snippet: Soon handheld 3-D cameras may cost less than $1,000, sparking a boom in visualization. A Russian mathematician has worked out ways to display the depth and texture of the world by projecting grids of light on things.
abstract: Soon handheld 3-D cameras may cost less than $1,000, sparking a boom in visualization. A Russian mathematician has worked out ways to display the depth and texture of the world by projecting grids of light on things.
